contents.name: X Marks the Spot
headers: Appendix A: Monster and NPC Statistics

item.name: Dowsing Dagger
entries: A curved jade blade fashioned by the River Heralds, this {@item dagger +1|dmg|+1 dagger} can detect the presence of fresh water within 200 feet of the wielder.

item.name: Pirate's Cutlass
entries: This {@item shortsword +1|dmg|+1 shortsword} is a terrifying weapon with a serrated edge. It grants its wielder advantage on Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks when brandished.

item.name: Primal Amulet
entries: This beaded jade necklace bears an ancient symbol of the River Heralds. When worn, the primal amulet allows its wearer to cast {@spell speak with animals}, {@spell locate object}, and {@spell pass without trace}. Once the amulet has been used to cast a spell, it can’t be used to cast that spell again until the next dawn.

item.name: Prying Blade
entries: A hooked blade useful on board a ship or as a cutting tool in the wilderness, this {@item shortsword +1|dmg|+1 shortsword} grants its wielder advantage on Strength ({@skill Athletics}) checks to climb or to escape while {@condition restrained}.

item.name: Sorcerous Spyglass
entries: This elegant brass spyglass features an intricate lens mechanism. A creature looking through the sorcerous spyglass has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks to detect things that can be seen. In addition, the user can view magical auras while looking through the spyglass, as if under the effect of a {@spell detect magic} spell.

item.name: Vanquisher's Banner
entries: This battle-worn but unbroken standard bears the insignia of one of the forces of the Legion of Dusk. A creature that holds the vanquisher’s banner can use a bonus action to grant an ally advantage on the ally’s next attack roll, saving throw, or ability check.
